name: GET_v3-senders-sender_id
description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific sender identity.**

on-behalf-of.default: The subuser's username. This header generates the API call as if the subuser account was making the call.

sender_id.description: The ID of the sender identity that you want to retrieve.

$ul: **address**: The physical address of the sender identity.
**city**: The city of the sender identity.
**country**: The country of the sender identity.
**email**: The email address from which your recipient will receive emails.
**name**: The name appended to the from email field. Typically your name or company name.
**nickname**: A nickname for the sender identity. Not used for sending.
**email**: The email address to which your recipient will reply.
**name**: The name appended to the reply to email field. Typically your name or company name.
**state**: The state of the sender identity.
**zip**: The zipcode of the sender identity.
**created_at**: The time the sender identity was created.
**id**: The unique identifier of the sender identity.
**locked**: True when the sender id is associated to a campaign in the Draft, Scheduled, or In Progress status. You cannot update or delete a locked sender identity.
**updated_at**: The time the sender identity was last updated.
**verified**: If the sender identity is verified or not. Only verified sender identities can be used to send email.
